name: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1978
Reason: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The phenyl groups in this compound contribute to an increase in melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may add approximately +30 to +50 °C. The chlorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their ability to participate in dipole interactions, estimated at around +10 °C each. The dioxole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 °C.
